Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2007 10:49PM evyl78 wrote: Hi Ladies, My name is Evy,  reading this thread has given me some great info.  Here is a bit about me, I am a 28 year old female turn 29 on 10/29.  I was dx on 10/3 with bc.  I am also pregnant 30wks, and have just started chemo this past monday 10/8.  I will do 1 round and then enduce my labor and have port and continue.  We are doing chemo first because of size 4cm and 3.5cm.  I havent really had any bad side effects yet, just tired and my stomach hurts and I have a slight cold plus hot at night...has anybody felt like hot flashes at night is that normal?

Kristina-hope the chickenpox are better and that you can do chemo this morning! Angie-glad to hear the port went well! Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2007 09:26AM - edited Dec 8, 2007 09:32AM by evyl78 HI ladies, I just wanted to take a moment and let you know that I am thinking of you.  I hope everyone is feeling well and having little or no se's!  Kristina, how are the pox and how are you feeling? I will post the pix on the kids with Santa if I ever get to the mall to take them for you all to see!  They are my pride and joy!  I miss talking with you guys, but I havent felt like myself I feel pretty goofy...I think its the percusets and the Ativan mixed with the Prenatal, Iron, stool softner and the antibotics plus 800mg of Ibrofin...I feel like  a drug store!  If any of you ladies ever just need to vent or want someone to talk to please know that I am always here and you can call my cell 513-267-0089 anytime!  ((((BIG BEAR HUGS))) Happy Holidays and I will be reading this board everyday  even when I dont post I like to just lurk....I normally am not very social butterfly with people, but you guys are not just people you are family and WILL ALWAYS be family, I could not have made it this far without your support and encouragement for that I thank you and love you ladies ~Evy~
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2008 11:46AM evyl78 wrote: Hey just dropped in to wish everyone a good hump day tomorrow =)....I have been thinkin about all of you lately and hope everything is going good and that everyone is enjoying the summer.  As if I didnt have enough on my plate, I promised Arianna when we moved into our home that I would get her a dog...I broke down and got her a toy fox terrier!  Lennon is sleeping all night, but now I have to get up (not like Im sleeping much anyway) to let Sugar out...but its worth it, just seeing the happiness it brings to both Arianna and Lennon!  My hair is finally to the point that I have to remember to water it down before I leave the house lol...and its starting to fall out again from the Taxol.  But oh well at least I know it will come back and its summer anyway so who gives a crap! I swear the goverement has me in a bad situation...as you know I lost my job the same day I found out could have bc...which was a blessing because I didnt have insurance.  Have been on medicaid ever since....but now I want to get back to work, but cant....if i go back I lose my medicaid and no insurance...what is a person to do??   Well hugs to all! ~Evy~
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2008 09:42PM evyl78 wrote: Hi my sisters!  Well today is Oct. 1st and its been one year since we started on this road together...I can never tell you how much you guys mean to me!  I have laughed, cried and felt so many emotions on this journey!  It just hit me today, that 1 year later I am finally letting everything sink in....my journey like all of ours has not been easy and at every turn there was a road block. So I never let myself fully take in what my dx ment....I think I wanted to believe that a year later my life would be back on track!  But here I am just starting radiation, and still taking herceptin...and I freaked out!  Yes life will never be the same, but at least I have a wonder dh, and 2 beautiful children, my family and my wonderful sisters here!  I guess what I am trying to say is thank you!  I dont think I could of made it this far without you guys!  I miss you all very much!  I need to take time for me and keep in touch with all of you more. Big hugs my sweet sisters  from the big cry baby of the group! ~Evy~

I miss so many on here, like Ulla, Kara, Deb...gosh a year later and still chemo brain lol..I know we have moved on but I still think of you all every day!!  Just wanted to make sure everyone is ok, please let us know either on here, or on my facebook page or myspace page. Lots of love ~Evy~

Karen-im glad you made it through the first round of chemo and pray all goes well. Debkay-Good luck with the second round I will have you in my prayers. Karyll-love the picture! Ulla you are in my thoughs I am so very sorry for your loss!! Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2007 02:59AM evyl78 wrote: Hi all my wonderful October ladies, I just wanted to take a moment and let you all know that you are in my thoughts and prayers! Ulla-I am so glad to see you  post, I was really worried about you, and have thought about you many times!  Please know that we are all here for you my sister! To everyone else-I hope everyone has a good week, my sisters that are going for the second round, I hope it goes okay and I will have you in my thoughts! I just wanted to jump on for a minute as I have started the dreadful shedding and I thought I was prepared for it, I keep making jokes and stuff to keep my family from worrying as they live 2 states away and my husband and in-laws, that I love and treat me in every sense of the word as if I was there own daughter, from being to upset! I dont think I am as prepared as I like to make everyone including myself believe!  Well a new week is here and another day on bumpy roads, just keep your chin up and remember you are all in my thoughts and prayers!
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2007 04:23PM evyl78 wrote: Hi everyone! I want to say welcome to all the new ladies!  Kristina-thank you!!  I am glad you are feeling better and eating! Angie-I am sorry food is not tasting good...I had the same problem.  I am glad to see  you are feeling good enough to go to work. Ulla-Keep your head up and I hope you feel better!! Karen, Cheryl, Penny, Kara, Karyll, and all my other october ladies...I have each and everyone one of you in my prayers everyday!  You all keep  my spirits up and have been a blessing in my life through this tough time!  Somebody on here said it best, you guys make me laugh, cry, and also let me vent!  God bless you all! Things have been a little crazy between all the doctors appointment..they had me on semi-bed rest and thank God my water level around baby went up so, I will be home for another week.  They will induce my labor on Nov. 11th and will have port put in at the same time.  I will then go for my second round a few days after being discharged from the hospital.  The onc.  said they may have to do a stronger dose of a/c.  I have been having  sharp pain in my breast and found a new lump about 1 1/2 weeks ago..we have been monitoring it and it continues to grow.  It is almost as big as the first 2 lumps (3.5cm & 4cm) together.  Its feels like half my breast is one big lump.  I cant wait to have my son, and then do MRI because I am so worried that it has spread especially since onc already told me I'm not in the beginning stages of BC  (sorry for venting)! I am bald now...partly by my own doing, was tired of shedding so I brushed out the lose hairs and DH shaved my head! I was happy with doing this as I had control.  I've even gone out bald, as I am a ponytail type person and chose to go with out a wig!  I am back to feeling better, if only until next round.  I will keep you all updated, now that I will home for most of next week. Okay ladies now that I ranted a bit (alot) I thank you all for your thoughts and prayers as you are always in mine!  ~Evy~
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2008 01:07PM evyl78 wrote: Hi my beautiful sister! I know its been awhile, but like always things are never easy.  I think I have reached the end of my rope.  I can't handle doing the chemo anymore...I'm considering talking to my Onc about stopping the taxol...because, I can't do this, care for Lennon & Arianna, and deal with my dh mental condition...he has had anxiety and panic attack, that have now become worse..its like he is not living a reality...I just cant be "Super Women" I thought I could and deal with working (from home), care for my kids, and husband, maintain my home...and that is before dealing wiht my needs.  My treatments have been taking about 5-8 hours and the whole time I am worried something is going on at home, my husband is texting me that he is "stressing".  I understand that, but I too am stressing, I am scared that all the pain I've been having is the "beast"....I have bone pain 24/7, my chest is constantly aching and thats b4 all the mental stuff....I have been able to put a wall up during all this, but I can't continue to act like everything is ok...like this is some kind of cold that is going away...I just want to be done!  I want my onc to redo my scans and tumor markers and if all is clear then take me off  taxol.  SO here I stand at this crossroad, not sure which way to go, I just need to be here for my family....Do I stop and hope its enough?  Or am I making the biggest mistake of my life?  Please my sweet sisters, I need your advice and wisdom, like never before.  I dont know what to do. Sorry for the long rant...we all know I'm good for that! I miss you ladies, ulla, Debra, Debbie, Linda, Kristina, Karen, Karen R., Kara, Cherly, Lolli and everyone else I trully luv you ladies and I hope you guys are doing better then me! ~Evy~
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2008 09:38PM evyl78 wrote: Hi my beautiful sisters It been awhile since I've posted but I have been reading up...I am doing okay staying busy with Lennon & Arianna.  I am still doing taxol weekly w/herceptin and it was kicking my butt!  On top of that me and dh where going thru some serious problems...he is seeing a head doctor, but dont know if its helping. My hair is starting to grow back, and its funny cause Ive gone without hats or wigs this whole time and now i think i need one....I just did my bone scan and there is a spot that was barely visable in the December scan, and now its big and bright, so time for an MRI! I swear sometimes I think its never going to end! Love all the new pictures you ladies are all so BEAUTIFUL! Linda-congrats on the boobies Cheryl-I am so sorry about the foot, I hope you are doing ok, and following doctors orders! Karen, Kara, Lori, Linda, Cherly,Ulla and all my other sisters I think of you everyday and keep you in my thoughts Here is a pic of the baby He is 5 months and over 13lbs...he loves to eat  Love ya all big hugs ~Evy~
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2007 10:50AM - edited Oct 19, 2007 10:53AM by evyl78 Hi Kristina I am so sorry you have the chicken pox and going through chemo....I know that has to make it even harder!  I wish I had strenght in a bottle to send your way!  I hope and pray that everything goes okay at the onc. tomorrow.   I know how it is waiting to find out what the next step is. Its the not knowing if there is a delay or if things are going as plan, that sometime make it harder! I did do the neupogen shots i was suppose to do them for 8 day but they made me do an extra day cause my white blood cells where to low for the doc. Karyll-I hope this second round goes okay for you...i understand the softner thing..I 2 had that issue I had my first round on a monday and could not go till Sunday!  My stomach was killing me and my husband wanted me to call the dr. but I am well how shall I say stubborn! lol.... Well all my Oct. Girls just keep your head up and remember we are not alone on this road we are all here for each other! Much love to all!  ~Eva~
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2008 01:40PM evyl78 wrote: Just checkin in with everyone!  Sorry to hear Ulla is having a hard time...I will say an extra prayer for her!  I miss you ladies and hate that I dont have much time, but with the kids plus all my extra drama, Im lucky to have to seconds to myself anymore!  Well I swear my doctor has it right, I am the problem child.  I did start my chemo back about 3 weeks ago, and after the second round I ended up in the ER (I should just go on there payroll I am there so much),  Again with the chest pains, but this time I also had real bad pain in my right like sharp cramps...they did a CT and turns out I had cyst on my ovaries.  Once I followed up with my onc and gyno, turns out they are on both sides and they are big!  I will be having them and my uterus removed.  Nothing like going through menopause before age 30.  My gyno who I must say I adore and trust, and I talked about just removing the ovaries but agreed why not take it all, dont want to leave an organ in there thats not doing anything and can becoming a breeding ground for cancer!  On top of that my DH broke his collar bone, 2 day before all this drama...so he is trying to help the best he can, but its hard on him cause he cant really help me with Lennon.  I sometimes wonder is someone just trying to test me to see how much I can take before i break.  Ok well now that I  done my normal kvetching, I know I shouldnt cause there are so many with situations worse then mine, but I cant help myself!  I hope everyone is having a good summer, how much life can change in just 1 year!  I love the new pics of the hair ladies!  They look awesome!  You guys are some of the strongest, tuffest, and sweetest kindest people I have the pleasure of knowin and holding a special place in my heart for you guys!  Stay strong and remember life is too short to sweat the small stuff, just enjoy  life and your loved ones!  Big hugs and positive thoughts to all!  ~Evy~
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2007 12:51PM evyl78 wrote: Hi Ladies, Sorry I haven't been on to update, I have had my hands full.  The port site is still hurting the $*%t out of me, and it sucks cause I am right handed and that is the side it is on.  I am going tomorrow to my onc. to get blood work and sit down and reevaluate the course of treatment now that Lennon is here and we can kinda set things in stone.  I am scheduled to due round two Tuesday.  I must say that I have tried to be "Billy Bad Butt" as far as my treatment but it is now starting to really get to me.   Before I was more worried about the baby and being pregnant and now that he is here safe and sound, I don't have to worry about him being born, but I worry more now about me being here for him and Arianna.  I guess it's that everything is finally catching up with me mentally. I hope that all the ladies with se's that they get better! Debbie-I am glad the fever is better! Cheryl-I hope the band went well rock on!! Kristina-I think the Christmas card idea is great!  It's the holidays and this year I learned to be thankful to the little things in life!   Time is to preciouse to worry about the little things that make us upset! Well ladies I am off to relax for a few while Ari & Lennon are sleeping! BIG BEAR HUGS to all my sistas I love you all!  ~Evy~

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2007 02:17AM - edited Nov 23, 2007 02:36AM by evyl78 HAPPY THANKSGIVING FROM THE LAYNE'S Ulla-My dear sista, I hope you are resting and feeling better we are all worried about you!  You are dealing with so much please know we are all here for you and love you! I want to say to everyone thank you!  Today is a day to give thanks and each and everyone of you have reminded me in a hundred different ways that even though we are fighting this beast we have alot to be thankful for! Kristina your post touch my heart in ways I can not express and was from  your heart and soul and was the  thing I needed to hear to get back to being thankful! This year I am so thankful for my family...my husband that is loving, Arianna who has such a big heart and is so big for her age, and my new addition baby Lennon, who I believe is my mircle and if it was not for him they might not have found this beast! The other thing I am thankful for is you ladies- You have given me strenght when I had none left Faith when I was feeling lost Hope & Love when I needed it most! So I wanted to take a moment and let you know that I love you guys and WE will beat this beast together!  Have a great thanksgiving with your familys! ~Evy~

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2007 10:56AM evyl78 wrote: Hi Ladies, I just wanted to say I hope everyone is having a great week and is se free or at least having little se. Karyll, I am sorry you are not feeling good...if I was closer I would go over and give the cancer a good Puerto Rican butt kicking lol... Well I met the surgeon today and foud out the tumors where 8cm and finally found out I am stage IIIA!  7 out of 10 Nodes positive...and will soon be doing scans to see if I have mets.  My onc wants to restart chemo ASAP!  I was suppose to have them out this morning and start chemo on Tuesday, but they only took one tube out so chemo will be next week.  Well enough ranting...I really just came on to say hi, but then I start off on my rants! Debbie, Kristina, Linda, both Karens, Karyll, Kara, Ulla, Lori and I am sorry just drew a blank so everyone else I forgot, I love you guys and I am always thinking about you and praying and sending positive vibes your way! Big Bear Hugs ~Evy~
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: May 14, 2008 12:04AM evyl78 wrote: Hi ladies, First, Karen THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU!!!  I LOVE IT AND IT IS SO SPECIAL TO ME!!! Well, ladies I learned be careful what you ask for, not to long ago I was thinking about stopping my chemo, but continued with it because I knew I had to, not only for me but for my family.  Well now, I had the MRI and thank god it was nothing more then some back thingy my doc explained, but then I started heart palpation, and they sent me for a MUGA test...it shows my heart was weakened by the chemo, so I am now on a month long break, NO TAXOL NO HERCEPTIN!  My onc says we will start in a month if my numbers go back up, but my cardiologist says I can never have the herceptin.   I guess I should what I say!  I took the test on April 30th, and was leaving the next day to go back home to Jersey for the breast cancer walk...my doc didnt want to ruin my trip, so she kept tellin me the results weren't in.  Today I go do an echo to confirm the finding of the Muga and then start heart meds.  Ladies if you have any sort of heart palpataion to chest pain have it checked!!  If it wasn't for the rapid heart beat I was having and a little chest pain which we all thought was anxiety they would of never found the weakened heart problem. Well ladies Im off to the doctors, I send my love and big hugs to you all!  I will be back later!
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2009 08:41AM evyl78 wrote: My sweet sisters, Its been a little over 2 years since we started this journey....I want to start by saying that I love you guys so much, you will forever hold a special place in my heart! Cheryl,  I know what you mean about FB sometimes I will write somthing and my family will call me with all kinds of questions.  Please know that you are in my thoughts and prayers and I am only about 4-5 hours away so if you need me let me know and I will have my car speeding north on 75!!  If you are doing a laprascopic surgery I can tell you its not too bad, I did it last year.   I pray that its b9b9b9!!  My wish for this Christmas is that we all stay cancer free.....I have seen to many people that I have met on this journey gone.  I want to be able to get together in 5 or 10 years and know what we have overcome and beaten to get there!  My life will forever be changed because of the love and support I have been given my you all.   MERRY CHRISTMAS my sweet sisters! Love always Evy

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2007 10:41PM evyl78 wrote: hi ladies, First you are all in my thoughts and prayers!  This is not an easy journey we are on.....but with the faith, love, and support I am sure we will make it on this very bumpy road. I hope everyone is doing ok after there chemo round and dealing with all the nasty side effects. Well things with me have been ok...it could always be worse....I met with a high risk pregnancy doctor who wants me to go ahead with the second round of chemo on 10/29 (just what I want to do on my b-day) and deliver the baby the week of nov. 12th.  I notified the Onc of this and will go ahead with round 2.  As if this is not enough to worry about, plus being super tired and now my body aches, I thought I felt another hard spot on the same breast...I just have to keep an eye on it, due to the pregnancy and have it rechecked next week.  I did my blood work and will find out the results today I hope.  I havent started losing my hair, but I keep telling myself Im ready for it...Im not so sure though.  I havent had that melt down yet, or good cry, Im trying to stay strong but it is wearing me down..it seems that my chemo plus the whole bc thing is all I think about now adays!  Its like I found out im ER-negative HER2-positive, and some ki-67 unfavorable and I cant stop trying to find more info out.  I guess if I keep my mind busy I wont break down!  Well ladies I am sorry to be such a downer today!  I read all your post and you guys give me strenght to keep going on this long road!  Blessings to all and Oct. chemo girls you are in my  thoughts and prayers everyday!  Evy

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2011 11:54PM evyl78 wrote: Hi all My name is Evay and I am hope to joi your group!  This is my second go around with chemo!  I was dx in 07 did ac+th,rads and unilateral mx my story back then was very complicated due to other factors!  Well fastfoward ti present I found a lump on my mx scar line,,,,,,after some time onc said lets just cut it out...well we did and turns out it was a local recurrence.  I will start chemo tomorrow 12/2 I will be doing TC (Taxol & Carboplatin) I was suppose to do herceptin as I am her2+++ but my e/f is still down from chemo before!  Will meet n cardiologist to see about coreg.  Luckly my oldest who is 9 is a big help and my lil guy is 4!  Life has been hard on them the last 4 years and this is just another bumb. Any tips on Carbo & Taxol... I did tax  before and the tingling of hands and feet are stil around almot 4yrs later.  Much love ~Evy~
Posts.Title: Has anyone started a Dec 2011 group? darlam mamabee

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2007 05:08PM - edited Nov 13, 2007 05:09PM by evyl78 Hi ladies, Just got home today....We are both doing ok!  I went in on Sunday hoping to do a natural delivery, but Lennon did not like the meds and his heartbeat kept dropping so I had to have an emergency c-section.  He was born at 421pm and weighed 4lbs and 2oz!  Even the premie cloths are too big....then this morning I had my port put in and that hurts more then my cut for the c-setion.  Both Lennon and I are home and I will download a picture this evening once the drugs wear off a bit and I can think of how to do it. Well I will be doing round 2 of chemo this tuesday....and I will be rereading all your post because I have only retained about 1/4 of what Ive read today...sorry its all these darn drugs, but I love all my special sistas and thank you all for your thoughts and prayers...I swear I could feel all the good vibes and each and everyone of you while I was in there, and it gave me strenght knowing that I had you beautiful ladies pulling and praying for me, in this bitter sweet time! A SUPER BIG HUG FROM ME AND LENNON TO YOU ALL! ~Evy~

I am glad she is coming but I am stressing at the same time we dont have that real close mom/daughter relationship, as my Grandma raised me and she is my "Mommy"!   I missed you ladies so much but I didnt want to come here feeling so depressed, because I didnt know what to say! Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2008 11:29AM evyl78 wrote: Hi Ladies, Well I finally got my computer back yea!  First let me welcome all the new wonderful ladies.  I know I have a lot of catching up to do! Things here have been SUPER CRAZY!  I did my 2nd round of A/C on 12/19 and had to go to my Onc everyday to get my neupegon shots including christmas day!  That round hit me like a ton of bricks,  but I put on my happy face.  Then on the day after Christmas, I had to go to the emergency room with Lennon...turned out he had a hernia.  I did round 3 on Wed. and Lennon had surgery yesterday!  I am dead tired....I havent slept since about 2am on Wed. night!  Lennon is doing ok and I am hanging in there....I am just worried I found another spot this time by my rib that feels like a pea.  Well my ladies, Debbie, Karen, Kara, Linda, Ulla, Karyll, and everone else big bear hugs and I hope to catch up by tonight....if I can keep my eyes open!  I missed you ladies so very much! ~Evy~

Today is a beautiful day here in southern Ohio, Arianna was excited she got to ride her bike! Texas Karen, ty for the message on myspace.  Kara what a beautiful stone. Cheryl love your pics!  Debbie, Karen, Lori, Ulla and all my sister love ya! ~Evy~

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2009 06:13AM evyl78 wrote: MY SISTER OMG....I am so overwhelmed by my trip!!!  First as you know I got a NED so this was great news and I celebrated in Dallas. I just got back from my trip...wanted to updated, I will be back later to catch up want to spend time with Lennon,  Arianna, & Chuck boy I missed them, but I would do this trip again in a blink of an eye This trip was a trip of a life time!!  There was so many young women affected by this beast, but the love they all shared was amazing....Every where you turned there was a pink ribbon or my favorite was a F*ck Cancer shirt the pink ribbon was the u lol....Besided here I have never felt the love and being able to be myself since dx and it was amazing.  It broke my heart seeing these young young girls there...and the husband that just lost his wife and was there for her in spirit!  I rode a mechanical BULL!! What a rush...the bellboy told us as we where leaving...you cancer girls are CRAZY & can party!   I send my love to you all, (((((HUGS)))))
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2009 02:52PM evyl78 wrote: Hi my wonderful sisters,  Lori, hit the nail on the head, even though we havent met there is not a day that goes by that I dont think of all of you and wonder how you are doing and how I MISS YOU SO MUCH!!  I will look at my beautiflul bracelet that ,means so much to me because it came from karen, and to me it represents the bond that I have with you all and the uncondition love that I have received because of this journey we have made together, that its hard for some to understand or I will wonder how cold it is in cleveland or just go on myspace to see what Lori status is...think about kara and her stonre, or deb and her daugher...I could go on but you guys get the message....i miss you all, we have gone on with our lives but everone of you have touched my life in a way that CAN NEVER be forgotten or taken away...you can always send me a message and like with my family if you need me I WILL BE THERE!!!  NObody messes with one of us with out messing wiht all all of us!!   I love you guys so much...and as the youngest of the group (I think) I want you all to know that I will take my prost. and use it as weapon and beat anyone who messes with my "FAMILY"!!!  Ok....now the ghetto puerto rican side of me is coming out...lol..sorry but I want all my beautiful sisters to know that I love them and I am here for you anytime always and forever!!

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2007 04:40PM evyl78 wrote: Hi October Girls, Just wanted to get on real quick!  I've been thinking about you ladies, but I was in the hospital for the last 24 hours. Things are going ok.  My second round has been delayed until the baby is born...it looks like they will enduce within the next 1-2 weeks.  My amniotic fluid was really low and they wanted to hydrated me, so I was admitted yesterday!  I didnt realize how much I was shedding until I was in a hopstital bed!  Thankfully I have Great Doctors!  My ob and my onc. have both been working hand in hand and it makes things easier!  My white blood cells are high and they are making me do a chest x-ray because I have a cold and they want to make sure its not phnemonia!  Well ladies,  I just wanted to do an updated I will be on later to address all of you, cause I been thinkin about each and everyone one of you!  ~Eva/Evy~ P.S I cant remember how I sign out....my real name is Eva but my family and friends call me Evy!  And I consider all you ladies friends, because I draw strenght from you and I am blessed to have found this form and all you ladies to help me on this journey!
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2007 08:46AM evyl78 wrote: Hi, I just wanted to jump online for a minute and see how everyone is doing?  For everyone who just did a round I hope things go smoothly for you.  I am loving the new pictures of you ladies with your wigs.  Kristina I hope that twin is all gone soon and the pox stay away! To the new ladies welcome and know that everyone here will support you! I havent been online lately due to bed rest...its driving me nuts and DH is being great and taking care of me like a pro!  I am almost feeling normal except for the fact that I think I stink and it is driving me nuts...my dd who is 5 told me I was going to turn into a duck from taking so many baths!  I will be going into the hospital this Sunday to give birth and have port put in the next day....I will then be doing my 2nd round about the 15th.  I am getting excited and nervous at the same time...the birth doesn't bother me, its the chemo...I have been a basket case the last few days worried that the chemo isn't working due to the new lump which is getting bigger every day it feels huge and just as big as the first two together  which are 3.5cm and 4.0cm plus having 3 different times of bc (IDC, DCIS, & mucinous) )...then I get online and read all your post and remember that I am not alone....I can come here and tell you things and emotions that I cant share with family because I dont want to make it worse on them!  Thank you all so much for your thoughts, prayers and support!  I am very grateful to have met you all and I am sure that going through this will create friendships and bonds that will last a very long life time!  Ok now Im getting sentimental so I will end this long blabbing post!  I will be thinking of you my "sistas" and praying for you!  I will updated again as soon as I can! ~Evy~
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2007 02:04PM evyl78 wrote: Hi everyone, Just wanted to jump online b4 I leave tomm morning and let you all know that I am thinking and praying for all of you!  I hope everyone is doing ok....Good luck with th next round I know some have a round on Monday and some on the 15th!  I wont do any shout out tonight as my brain is so racked I am not sure I will get anything straight, but wanted to let you know I am thinkin of all you and sending positive vibes your way!   I will be post again when I am out of the hospital, and I will most def. put a pic up of the baby!  Have a great week! ~Evy~

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2007 12:48PM evyl78 wrote: How things can change in the blink of an eye...I saw my onc today to get a blood work and prepare for chemo tomorrow, but now that is not happening.  Like I told you ladies awhile ago I found that "new" lump on the same breast, well it is as big if not bigger then the other two together!  Mind you I am far from small breasted to begin with (40DD) and my left breast is twice as big as my right one.  The onc said the BEAST had not shrunk with the chemo and with the new lump she wants it out like yesterday!   She called my surgeon, and he said he can fit me in this week.  I will meet with him on Wed and find out when they will do a mastectomy....she said they both want it done within the week!  Now I'm trying to cope mentally from thinking I would have a lumpectomy in a couple of months to finding this out and trying to figure out do I want a single or double....thas sounds funny if it was as easy as ordering icecream one scoop or two!  I am sorry to everyone I know that lately all I do is complain but you ladies are my only outlet. My dh is being so supportive I try not to put to much more on his plate...and my inlaws are always supportive and my family is Jersey and they are taking this so hard, I end up calming them down and supporting them, that they freak out over everything! Please know that even though I am just venting I am still thinking of you all, Linda, Kristina, Debbie, Kara, Karyll, Karen, Cheryl, Karen, Alishar, Lori, Ulla and everyone else...sorry having a blank moment!  I thank you all more then I can every express and luv you guys!!  You have been so supportive I don't know that I could make it on this rollercoaster without you guys!  I thank God I found you ladies!  Sorry this is such a long post! Big Bear Hugs ~Evy~
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2007 09:40PM evyl78 wrote: well ladies i am still here! my computer crashed so im down to dh cellphone for internet. surgery went ok just alot of draining and pain in my arm. depression hit me. i got my second tube out monday and did chemotherapy today. i havent felt good since surgery i love all your christmas cards they have put a huge smile on my face l will mail mine tomorrow. natalie- welcome god luck these ladies are all great they have given me strength and made me cry becauze they have touched my heart in a way that i cant explain they will always hold a very special place in my heart kara- my family is from newark nj and essex county is doing the walk for the cure in may at branch brook park if i get the green light to fly we are going to do it as a family. well ladies i cant think so will be back oh linda and karyll dont let those jackass at work get to you! we will get a group of us to kick there butts the same as way we are kicking cancers ass! kristina, debbie, karen, karen r, lollin ulla and all my sisters big hugs and feel good your in my thoughts and prayers big hugs -evy- p.s i miss my puter thois phone is to hard lol
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2008 12:25PM evyl78 wrote: My beautiful sisters, First, Karen I am SO deeply sorry for your lost.  My prayers go out to you and your family.  Age is not important in love, as many of you know I am somewhat young  only 29. My husband of 11 years is 49.  Yes I got married at 18 and he was 38!  I know, I havent had time to check in lately, however, reading that beautiful poem and the rest of the post...I must tell ALL of you THANK YOU!! THANK YOU, for letting me rant, for being there when I needed and saying what I needed to hear!  Thank you for making this miserable journey that we are on, one that I did not have to do alone....and being blessed by finding all of you!  Each and everyone of you have touched my heart in this process and I dont know that I would have been able to make it without you!  I love you guys more then words can express! Well its been two months since I had to stop chemo, and my heart is back to normal, according to my stress test.  My Onc wants to start chemo again and so do I (never in my life would I have thought that I WANT to do chemo)!  The stupid Cardiologist wont call her back..she has been trying to reach him since Thursday.  I really dont like this guy.  My kids are doing great, Arianna is now 6 and is enjoying summer and her friends...baby Lennon, is doing awesome..he is now 7 months..how time flys and goes slow at the same time...he is moving and growing like a weed, he eats like no tomorrow, love the water, and most importanly is HEALTHY!.  I cant believe its been 8 months since we all started chemo, and how we have all found some great friends and people that have touched are life in a special way...a way that I am sure we all hold precious and close to our hearts...ok hear I go rambling so I am off, to check on Lennon. ~Evy~

Big hugs to all! ~Evy~

Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2011 01:42AM evyl78 wrote: Secret we arer on the same schedule I do my second tx tomorrow!  Will be thinking of you!  For those with little ones the first time I let my then 5 yr old help daddy cut my hair and then it kinda fell out after I sat for hours brushing it!  This time my now 9 yr old and me made a day of itwe went and got our hair cut I got a cute style but once the tingling started I had one of my best friend come over and shave it!  My 4 old son and 9yr old knew and came and watched when they wanted.    I am so happy for no mets Market!! Rachel hope the fever is down! My vision bothers me but know that I think of each and everyone of you and Wish you all a Merry Christmas!  Much love ~Evy~ Im going to try to upload a new avatar showing my shaved head :)
Posts.Title: Has anyone started a Dec 2011 group? darlam mamabee

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2011 11:02PM evyl78 wrote: Hi all I hope everyone is having  a good week!  For those having treatment this week may it be with few se.  I  go tomorrow for bloodwork.  It is day 9 and I have good and bad days.  This is my second time doing chemo I did AC+Tand herceptin for a year.  I did not expect the pain I had I did taxol before but not with carboplatin and It was weekly so I ddint do the nuelasta last time.  The claritin did nothing!! My percs did nothing!  Nothing helped I had family pictures last monday aneI got sick as soon as pictures where done!  My DH wanted a family portrait before I lose my hair. again we went Monday and I barely got thru it but I dod.  My kids have been great I have a 9yr old daughter and 4yr old  son. I cut my hair yesterday me and dd went to get hair cut and I like it :) I am ready for it fall even though I am having a hard time emotionally with it seems harder this time.  I didnt have any mouth trouble before but now the tip of my tongue feels like its blistered just feels off.  My tongue has a split it in very weird!  The other se I am having that I didnt before is the vision change.   Sometimes its like everythinf is blurry or smokey foggy.  I have bad eyes to begin with and stopped wearing contacts after first dx.  I am thinkging as much as I dont want more appointments I have to go see eye dr.  For those worried about heart damage with AC it can happen and you need ot report all changes.  I am presently not doing herceptin because my ef is down.  I have an appointment Tues. with my new cardiologist going to talk to him about putting me on Coreg. I was on it before and my ef went up but I was stupid stop talking it and didnt see a heart dr. in a while I had just started seeing this guy right before get dx again because I wasnt feeling right for some time.
